info.title: Resume - Topolsky Ladislav
info.description:
This is a documentation for the Resume REST API based on the OpenAPI 3.1 specification. The purpose of this documentation is to provide user with callable API Endpoints with description of the request and response payload. As well short descrption of the routes and their purpose. You can find out more information about me at [topolsky.eu](https://topolsky.eu).

All of the parameters in GET requests contains URL encoded objects.

 Example: ?include=%7B%22skills%22%3Atrue%7D = (?include={"skills":true})

Link to the resume api repository:
- [Resume API Repo](https://github.com/lacinko/resume-api)

API endpoints that modify the data are allowed only with API Key. Provided operations are only to document other types of requests and are not accessible to public.

tags.name: projects
tags.description: Explore my projects that I have built

get.summary: List of all the companies that I have worked for
get.description: Get the list of all the companies that I have worked for.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Filter companies based on condition.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
Select fields from company object. 

(Include and select parameters can't be called together.)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Include fields from skills object. 

(Include and select parameters can't be called together.)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the list based on value.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Select an amount of records to display.

requestBody.description: Create a new company in the DB (The name property has to be unique)

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: ID of company to return

examples: The Adecco Group Czech Republic works to get people into work...
The Adecco Group Czech Republic works to get people into work...
A description of the HTML/CSS Developer role.

As an HTML/CSS Developer I collaborated with designers to implement web designs using the Foundation CSS framework. My role involved ensuring proper HTML semantics, adhering to web design best practices, and integrating new design elements. I contributed to projects on GitLab daily, ensuring version control and seamless teamwork.
The Adecco Group Czech Republic works to get people into work...
